title: Tetsumasa Kimura
text:
is a former <a href="Japan">Japan</a>ese <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player and manager.
Playing career.
Kimura was born in <a href="Yamato%2C%20Kanagawa">Yamato</a> on January 24, 1972. After graduating from <a href="Komazawa%20University">Komazawa University</a>, he joined <a href="Japan%20Football%20League%20%281992%E2%80%9398%29">Japan Football League</a> (JFL) club <a href="Kyoto%20Sanga%20FC">Kyoto Purple Sanga</a> in 1994. From 1996, he played for <a href="Japanese%20Regional%20Leagues">Regional Leagues</a> club <a href="Blaze%20Kumamoto">Blaze Kumamoto</a>, JFL club <a href="FC%20Kariya">Denso</a> and <a href="Ventforet%20Kofu">Ventforet Kofu</a>. At Ventforet Kofu, the club was promoted to new league <a href="J2%20League">J2 League</a>. He played as regular right side back. In 2000, he moved to <a href="J1%20League">J1 League</a> club <a href="JEF%20United%20Chiba">JEF United Ichihara</a>. However he could not play at all in the match. In 2001, he moved to <a href="Japanese%20Prefectural%20Leagues">Prefectural Leagues</a> club <a href="Arte%20Takasaki">Gunma FC Horikoshi</a>. From 2003, he moved to New Zealand and played for <a href="East%20Auckland%20FC">East Auckland</a>, <a href="University-Mount%20Wellington">University-Mount Wellington</a> and <a href="Onehunga%20Sports">Onehunga Sports</a>. He retired end of 2004 season.
Coaching career.
In 2012, Kimura became a manager for <a href="Japanese%20Regional%20Leagues">Regional Leagues</a> club <a href="SC%20Sagamihara">SC Sagamihara</a> in 2012. The club was promoted to <a href="Japan%20Football%20League">Japan Football League</a> from 2013 and <a href="J3%20League">J3 League</a> from 2014. In 2015, he moved to Regional Leagues club <a href="Vonds%20Ichihara">Vonds Ichihara</a> and became a coach. In May 2014, he became a manager and managed the club until end of 2014 season.
